common_issues.title: PiecesOS Rate Limiting and Processing Errors
common_issues.description: Users reported processing errors and limitations using certain GPT models due to rate limiting in PiecesOS versions 10 and 11.  Solutions included authentication, increasing rate limit windows, and reinstalling the OS.  Contact Pieces support for persistent issues.

related_issues.title: I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.13

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[com.pieces.pfd.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17891327/com.pieces.pfd.zip)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9a6f930-4d30-41ad-8d70-b81d9c3f7e6f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99d91958-8fb7-4f27-9efa-9d628127e90f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d1c630b-816c-488d-87f9-202a86d63820)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e8278a0-eca0-4b4e-bcaa-a5b195da5562)

## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Rate Limiting Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were experiencing an error message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"
* This was due to new rate limiting introduced in PiecesOS
* The rate limiting issue was affecting both cloud and local processing
* Some users were unable to resolve the issue through email communication with the Pieces team

**Problems Identified:**

* Rate limiting was too aggressive and impacting regular users
* Lack of clear error message for rate limiting
* Difficulty resolving the issue through email communication

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Manual increase of rate limit for affected users
* New error message for rate limiting 
* Requirement of authentication for cloud processing
* New version of PiecesOS (11.0.0) with increased rate limit window for signed in users
* Adjusted port for sending snapshot of applications (39300)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Rate limiting issue has been resolved for most users
* New rate limit window and error message implemented in PiecesOS 11.0.0
* Authentication required for cloud processing

**Additional Notes:**

* Users can still contact Mark at Pieces for assistance with rate limiting issues: https://calendar.app.google/knJSkkMhFomcQMcs7
* Be sure to include response from http://localhost:39300/applications (or http://localhost:1000 for users on older versions) when contacting Mark

**Overall, the rate limiting issue has been resolved for most users. However, if you are still experiencing this issue, please contact Mark at Pieces for assistance.**

related_issues.title: I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
related_issues.text:
I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

If the model is 4o Mini, everything works fine.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @int80x0 reported an issue with receiving an error message in Pieces.
* Pieces support bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* Mark from Pieces identified the issue as a common problem and suggested solutions.

**Problems Identified:**

* User received an error message: "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few minutes and try again."
* This issue could be due to rate limiting or problems within the conversation flow.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Authenticate to resolve rate limiting.
* Contact Pieces support for further assistance if the issue persists.
* Refer to the provided related issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/471) for more information.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was marked as a duplicate and closed.
* The user was advised to review the related issue for further assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The problem was identified as a common issue with PiecesOS 10.0.0.
* The issue should be resolved in PiecesOS 11.0.0.

**Problem:** Martina Frazzoni (@martinafrazzoni) reported that Pieces app wasn't working.

**Key points:**

* Issue automatically triaged to the proper team
* Automatic response provided links to similar issues and helpful resources
* Mark (@mark-at-pieces) from Pieces support acknowledged the report and suggested uninstalling and reinstalling with a different method.
* Mark suggested checking another related issue.
* Martina reported the app works perfectly after reinstalling using a different method.

**Solutions:**

**Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved by reinstalling the OS.

**Current status:**

* Issue closed, problem solved.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Crashes When Adding Folders
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing PiecesOS crashes when attempting to add folders from specific Windows 10 builds. The issue seems to be related to the interaction between PiecesOS and certain system configurations. A patch has been released to address some instances of the problem, and the Pieces team is actively investigating and working on a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
_PiecesOS Information_

**ID:** 18986c5c-5aef-40f4-ac00-93da40fd8b47
**User:** 1446bb64-5370-4644-a0ee-5ab3b4f3a7ac
**Current Version:** Unknown
**Min Version Supported:** 11.0.0
**Max Version Supported:** 12.0.0
**Local Port:** 127.0.0.1:39300

_Device Information_

**Operating System:** Windows
**Current Version:** "Windows 10 Pro" 10.0 (Build 26100)
**Min Version Supported:** Windows 10 Build 1903

Pieces for developers always loosing connection and self closing pieces OS
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points:**

* User `rafael-a-g-n` reported an issue with Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting frequently.
* The issue occurred after updating to the latest version.
* The user provided a workaround involving uninstalling and reinstalling the software, and deleting specific folders.
* Pieces team member `tsavo-at-pieces` acknowledged the issue and confirmed that a patch would be released to address it.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS disconnecting and restarting unexpectedly.
* Workaround requiring manual folder deletion.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User workaround: Uninstall/reinstall and delete folders.
* Pieces team solution: Released a patch to handle alternative installation locations gracefully.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of the patch.
* Users are no longer required to perform the manual workaround.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop App - Lost Connection to PiecesOS
_PiecesOS Information_

**User:** 61095a0d-c770-4dbb-b74a-1ecbe495e84d

**Current Version:** "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
**Min Version Supported:** Windows 10 Build 1903

When adding folder, tried on both claude 3.5 and gpt 4o (cloud), pieces OS is crashing (lost connection to PiecesOS screen is shown)
Adding specific file does work though.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Lost Connection to PiecesOS"

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** User @ShauryaKesarwani reported losing connection to PiecesOS in the Pieces Desktop App.
* **Triage:** The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* **Related Issues:** The bot suggested three related issues about lost connection to PiecesOS.
* **Resources:** The bot provided links to existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.
* **Duplicate:** @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/536.
* **Closure:** The issue was closed as a duplicate.
* **Root Cause:** The issue is likely related to the specific build of Windows being used.
* **Status:** The Pieces team is actively investigating the issue.

**Outcome:**

* The user's issue was identified as a duplicate and closed.
* The Pieces team is actively working to resolve the underlying issue causing lost connections to PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers App Crashing on Windows
common_issues.description: Users reported crashes in the Pieces for Developers app on Windows, particularly when adding files or folders as context. The issue seemed to be related to specific OS builds and the app installer distribution. A patch (11.0.2) was released to address the problem, and users confirmed its effectiveness.

related_issues.title: Bug: Adding Folder as context (on Windows) crashes PiecesOS within the Copilot
related_issues.text:
Bug: Adding Folder as context (on Windows) crashes PiecesOS within the Copilot
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We are tracking down an issue right now on Windows w/ regard to Typescript folders crashing PiecesOS on 11.0.0.

So far we are unable to reproduce this behavior on Macos, but are still looking deeper into this issue in the Windows Ecosystem.

Please let us know in this issue if you are experiencing similar behavior on windows or if things are working properly.

Thank you in advance!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The issue concerns files and folders not being added to context or taking a long time to do so
* This appears to be related to a specific OS build

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue affects Pieces for Developers app on Windows 11
* It seems to be particularly related to a specific OS build
* The root cause was initially unclear but later identified as the app installer distribution

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Collecting information from users experiencing the issue
* Filing a ticket
* Tracking down the issue further
* Linking the issue to a related one in the os_server repository
* Releasing a patch (11.0.2) to address the issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of Patch 11.0.2
* Confirmed by user sirius-beck that everything is working correctly after updating

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was specific to an OS build and not a general problem with the app
* The patch release effectively addressed the issue
* The communication between the support bot and mark-at-pieces was informative and transparent

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update Triggers False Positives
common_issues.description: Recent Pieces OS updates are triggering false positive alerts from various antivirus and security software, causing concern among users. This issue affects multiple operating systems and plugins. The Pieces team is actively investigating and addressing these false positives. Users experiencing this issue are advised to update their antivirus software, whitelist Pieces OS, or consider temporarily disabling their antivirus while using Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
related_issues.text:
OSX/Nukesped.ext reported by VirusBarrier
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Intego VirusBarrier has quarantined the following Apps as being infected with OSX/Nukesped.ext

- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- MacOSx/Applications/Pieces.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A/App
- /Library/Caches/com.pieces.os/org.sparkle-project.Sparkle/Installation/rXFHYYDjc/Pieces OS.app/Contents/Frameworks/App.framework/Versions/A

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32bfc7dc-fda4-4377-8eb1-348cab1106b6)



## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* idiston reported an issue with Pieces OS being flagged as infected by Intego VirusBarrier.
* The issue appeared to be a false positive with the detection occurring in standard macOS application bundle locations.
* Pieces OS is a legitimate development tool with specific system access requirements.

**Problems:**

* Intego VirusBarrier flagged Pieces OS as infected.
* The false positive detection could potentially lead to users uninstalling Pieces OS.

**Solutions:**

* tsavo-at-pieces suggested updating Intego VirusBarrier definitions and/or reporting the false positive to Intego.
* idiston confirmed they did a clean uninstall and reinstall of the latest Pieces OS version.
* The team agreed to investigate further to see if the issue could be reproduced.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* The team are working to resolve the false positive detection.

**Outcome:**

* The desired outcome is for the false positive detection to be resolved by Intego. 
* This will prevent users from being unnecessarily concerned about the security of Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
related_issues.text:
Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
### Software

VS Code, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Yesterday was working great. Minutes ago it prompt me to update Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. After the update both Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working.

PHPStorm says - It looks like port 1000 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 1000.

And Vscode says - Please update the Pieces for VS Code extension to the latest version. This version is only compatible with Pieces OS versions less than 11.0.0, and  you have 11.0.0 installed. But there isn't any Vscode plugin update.

Can you help? Is there a way to downgrade?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/973ecc53-1230-4b25-93df-b8f258273f19)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0d82807-7d45-4279-af39-b223896bd4ca)

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* A user reported their antivirus flagged the latest Pieces OS update as suspicious.
* The user acknowledged the update is known to be safe.

**Problems Identified:**

* The update triggered false positives from some antivirus software.
* This could deter users from installing important updates.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* The development team acknowledged the issue and attempted to address it.

**Current Status:**

* The issue persists as of the last comment.
* Further investigation and resolution are required.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is unresolved. Users may experience problems with antivirus software and the update.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that a new version of Pieces OS was released.
* The build for VsCode is expected to be ready within a few hours.

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine Activation Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported difficulties enabling the Long-Term Memory Engine, encountering issues with the toggle button and receiving messages prompting them to enable LTM despite it appearing active. This problem was attributed to software bugs, particularly affecting specific operating systems like Linux (Wayland) and Windows (WSL). Solutions involved software updates, troubleshooting steps for specific environments, and bug fixes implemented by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: LTM doesn't work; the copilot model by defaults not saved
related_issues.text:
LTM doesn't work; the copilot model by defaults not saved
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[https://disk.yandex.ru/i/Z_U0FzYA8NBrNg](url)
There is a video here that describes the problem
## GitHub Issue Summary: Long-Term Memory Engine not activating

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Iliya3ProX) reported an issue with the Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) not activating in Pieces.
* User provided a video demonstrating the problem.
* Pieces Support (@pieces-support-bot) recommended related issues and resources.
* Mason (@mason-at-pieces) requested Pieces OS logs for further investigation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Downloaded local LLM's state was overriding the saved model configuration, preventing LTM activation.
* Issue persisted even after updating to version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the Desktop application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack (@mack-at-pieces) identified the root cause of the issue and implemented a fix.
* The fix was released in a patch by EOD on December 19th, 2024.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User updated to the latest version but LTM remains inactive.
* User provided updated logs and a video demonstrating the issue.

**Next Steps:**

* Pieces team needs to investigate the issue further based on the new logs and video provided by the user.

related_issues.title: Can't turn on long term memory engine
related_issues.text:
Can't turn on long term memory engine
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i keep clicking on the button but the ltm engine wont turn on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d91ee8ce-b8e1-4f28-9785-02d488d88775)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: LTM Engine Not Turning On

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@sh02sahil) reported that the LTM engine in Pieces was not turning on.
* User tried various troubleshooting steps, including restarting Pieces OS and switching to cloud mode.

**Problems Identified:**

* Initial troubleshooting steps were ineffective.
* User was using WSL, which was causing issues with the VSCode extension.
* LTM was fully functional, but there were known issues with context crashing POS on Windows and Claude 3.5 sonnet in the copilot.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-Pieces recommended waiting for a release with a potential fix.
* User was advised to try POS version 11.0.0 and update all extensions and desktop apps.
* User was directed to troubleshooting steps for WSL environments.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed that the LTM engine is now functional after updating to version 11.0.0.
* However, the VSCode extension is still inaccessible due to the WSL environment.
* Known issues with context crashing POS on Windows and Claude 3.5 sonnet remain.

**Additional Notes:**

* User has an upcoming call with Mark-at-Pieces to discuss other issues and questions.
* Mark-at-Pieces closed the issue but encouraged the user to reopen if any problems persist.

related_issues.title: Can't turn on Long-Term Memory Engine
related_issues.text:
Can't turn on Long-Term Memory Engine
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.11 and Pieces for Developers 3.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello all and thanks again for that great Pieces app!
I have a problem, i can't turn on Long-Term Memory Engine in the option menu
I can't turn it on when i start a copilot chat, i see the box to enable it, i click on it, i can see the green valid mark that shows the  Long-Term Memory Engine is on but when i try to write something and send the request, i just see that:

"In order to get the most out of Long-Term Memory (LTM) Context, you need to enbale the Long-Term Memory Engine, which provides time-based contextual awereness for your Copilot."
With 2 buttons under the text : 
-  "Enbale Long-Term Memory engine" (which is not working when i click on it) 
-  "Learn about LTM Context"

I can't use anymore Copilot chat which is a bit difficult to use PIeces well. If you need more info related on my configuration or something else feel free to ask :)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* The issue is related to the menu option (popover) and not the PiecesOS desktop app itself.
* The issue is specific to Linux, and some users reported it on Manjaro and Pop!_OS.
* There might be an underlying issue with Wayland causing LTM (Low-Touch Mode) not to function properly.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM was not working on Linux with Wayland, specifically on Manjaro and Pop!_OS. 
* This issue affected the menu options and popovers.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A solution for both Wayland and X11 was developed and is currently in the testing phase.
* This fix is expected to roll out shortly.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue should be resolved with PiecesOS version 11.0.0. 
* Users are encouraged to reopen the issue or add a new ticket if the problem persists after updating to 11.0.0.

## Additional Notes:

* The conversation also includes information about the versions of PiecesOS and Pieces For Developers being used by the affected users.
* The issue is being closed based on the assumption that the fix will be included in version 11.0.0.

recommendations: **Address PiecesOS Rate Limiting and Processing Errors:** Investigate and implement long-term solutions for rate limiting issues in PiecesOS, such as clearer communication about rate limits and improved error handling. Explore options for more flexible rate limits for authenticated users.

**Mitigate PiecesOS Crashes When Adding Folders:** Prioritize finding a permanent solution for crashes related to adding folders, particularly on specific Windows 10 builds. Improve error logging and diagnostics to better understand the root cause of these crashes.

**Investigate and Resolve Pieces for Developers App Crashes:** Continue monitoring and addressing crashes in the Pieces for Developers app on Windows, especially those related to specific OS builds and installer distributions. Ensure thorough testing of updates and patches to prevent similar issues in the future.

**Proactively Address Pieces OS Update False Positives:** Collaborate with antivirus vendors to resolve false positive detections of Pieces OS updates. Provide clear instructions to users on how to whitelist Pieces OS or report false positives to their antivirus providers.

**Improve Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine Activation Experience:** Address software bugs affecting LTM activation, particularly on Linux (Wayland) and Windows (WSL). Provide clear troubleshooting steps for users experiencing LTM activation issues in different environments.

**Review and Optimize Most Active Support Tickets:** Analyze the root causes of the most active support tickets, such as ticket numbers 471, 539, 536, and others. Identify common trends and implement solutions to prevent similar issues from recurring. This may involve improving documentation, bug fixes, or feature enhancements.
